quit.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely
quit.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
She has decided to quit show business.
People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
quit.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to stop doing something, especially something that is bad or annoying
quit.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The majority of smokers say that they would like to quit the habit.
Quit it, Robby, or I’ll tell mom!
We’ve done what we can. Let’s quit.
He’s been given six months to live if he doesn’t quit drinking.
I wish you’d all quit complaining.
quit.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to leave a house or apartment that you have been renting
quit.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The landlord gave them notice to quit the premises within seven days.
quit.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: It was ten years since he had quit Russia.
quit.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to leave your job, especially because you are annoyed or unhappy with it
quit.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Some people quit after only a few months in the job.
He quit a management training job at Sears.
quit.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to close a computer program when you have finished using it
quit.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: To shut the machine down, quit Windows and then switch off the machine.
